instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3024: What is 820-3024? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at apple logo screen
threads.message:
hi, this mac came in stuck at apple logo screen. 
sparepart problem has been eliminated, its logicboard problem.
<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> looks like its have been replaced by previous tech, but im not sure about the bios file they use.
the google drive link you share for this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> at other post is dead now..
does anyone have known good clean me for this ? thanks...
